summary: The Coast Guard is spending billions of dollars to replace aging ships, aircraft, and other assets. Because the Coast Guard has managed its acquisitions with a short-term, asset-by-asset focus, it has at times lost sight of the balance and cost of its overall asset portfolio. For example, some high-priority acquisitions have been delayed. Also, the Coast Guard continues to operate its fleets for longer than...
title: Coast Guard Acquisitions: Actions Needed to Address Longstanding Portfolio Management Challenges
